4:17.race_name: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Diablo Rojo
runners.breeder: J Hanly, A Stroud & Skymarc Farm
runners.comment: Useful form on turf last year; watch market on return after wind surgery; tongue-tie on
runners.spotlight: 325,000gns yearling; made an impressive winning debut at Redcar (6f, good to firm) last July and wasn't disgraced when sixth of 11 in a Group 3 at York (7f, good to firm) the following month; closely related to an AW winner and a half-brother to another (Crafter, runs in the 2.17); returns from seven months off in a tongue-tie having undergone wind surgery; market informative.

runners.name: Don Pacifico
runners.comment: Off the mark at Southwell in December, but he may need a stiffer test than this now
runners.spotlight: Built on a promising debut when winning a Southwell novice (6f, Tapeta) in December; the form of that race hasn't really worked out, though, and he may need a stiffer test than this now.

quotes.race: BetUK. It's Where The UK Bets EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: It was a lovely performance. Don Pacifico put that experience at Wolverhampton to good use and I was very comfortable once I got him relaxed and in a rhythm. He's still inexperienced and had a look around in the straight so hopefully there's more to come- Jack Mitchell, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Gallant
runners.comment: Won at Kempton in October and the form of that race has worked out very well
runners.spotlight: Showed ability on debut and built on it with a tongue-tie enlisted when winning a Kempton novice (6f, Polytrack) in October; the form of that race has worked out very well and he is much respected back from six months off.

runners.name: Hello Zaman
runners.comment: Won a C&D novice with plenty of authority in January; this is harder but still respected
runners.spotlight: Showed a combination of greenness and ability on his debut, but despite again running green he won a novice over this C&D with plenty of authority in January; this is harder, but he remains open to further improvement and being proven under the conditions must count for something.

quotes.race: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands B, C And D) (GBB) (Div I)
quotes.quote: I've always liked Hello Zaman a lot. He had a few little babyish niggles as a two-year-old, which is why he didn't appear until December and he was very green on debut. Thankfully, he showed a bit more like what we think of him there. He was still a bit green, so I'd hope he can step forward again and be quite smart in time. I think he'll be a sprinter being by Hello Youmzain, his last furlong was his best, so I think six furlongs will be his trip - James Tate, trainer.

runners.name: Luzon Prince
runners.comment: Unraced for Godolphin; this looks a hot race in which to make his debut
runners.spotlight: Pinatubo gelding; picked up from Godolphin for 4,000gns in October; half-brother to winners Silver Jubilee (6f/1m including UAE dirt/Qatar; RPR 91) and Specialisation (8.6f AW; 82); unraced dam closely related to Listed winners Ferdoos (1m4f; dam of 1m2f Group 1 winner Nezwaah) and Brusco (14.5f/1m7f); this looks a hot race in which to make his debut; stable also runs fellow newcomer Maury.

runners.name: Maury
runners.comment: Faces a daunting task in this field on debut
runners.spotlight: Earthlight gelding; 72,000euros foal, 220,000gns yearling, 16,000gns 2yo; half-brother to 5f/6f winner Pipsy (including 2yo/AW/US Grade 3; RPR 104); dam unraced half-sister to French 12.5f Group 2 winner Ziyad, out of half-sister to top-class middle-distance filly Aquarelliste; faces a daunting task in this field on debut.

runners.name: Pure Imagination
runners.comment: Well beaten on debut; handicaps over further should suit in due course
runners.spotlight: 28-1 when a well-beaten eighth of ten on last month's Southwell debut (7f, Tapeta); handicaps over further should suit in due course.

runners.name: Sassy Sprezzatura
runners.comment: Out the back in both starts at Kempton last summer; no appeal
runners.spotlight: Out the back in both starts at Kempton (6f, Polytrack) last summer; no appeal.

2:17.race_name: Â£30 In Free Bets With BetUK Handicap

runners.name: Etretat
runners.comment: 2lb higher than when winning over C&D in January, but below form lately and drawn widest
runners.spotlight: Down in class and just 2lb higher than when winning over C&D in January, but not at his best of late and the outside stall is no help.

runners.name: Prince Rasam
runners.breeder: Razza Del Sole Societa Agricola Srl
runners.comment: Lightly raced since winning sole start at two; back from another absence; plenty to prove
runners.spotlight: Won a four-runner Chelmsford novice (1m2f, Polytrack) on his only outing as a 2yo, but out of the frame in all four starts after reappearing last April; still unexposed but he returns from another 224 days off with plenty to prove; hood returns.

runners.name: Obsidian Knight
runners.comment: Four-time winner over 1m2f around here; had excuses last time; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner over 1m2f around here and just 1lb higher than for the latest in November; looked to be on the way back when second of eight off 1lb higher over C&D early last month, but endured a wide trip back here three weeks later; shortlisted.

quotes.race: Huge Daily Boosts Only At BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: Obsidian Knight has won round here three times now but I wouldn't say he has to come here. What he needs is a proper gallop, and he got one today. We're looking forward to running him on the turf, but whether we give him a break or go for one of the bonuses, I'll speak to the owners and see what they want to do. He seems to handle the track lovely and Tom gave him an absolutely perfect ride - Terry Kent, trainer.

runners.name: Foreseen
runners.comment: Won in France and second at Newmarket in November, but poor since; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Won in France (1m, heavy) a year ago and best effort for Adam West when second of 14 at Newmarket (1m1f, good; first-time blinkers) in November, but poor in three subsequent starts (one over hurdles) including on stable debut at Kempton (1m, Polytrack) last month; others preferred.

runners.name: Ellexis
runners.comment: C&D winner off 1lb lower in January; respected back here; cheekpieces on
runners.spotlight: Overcome the widest stall when winning an amateur riders' event from 1lb lower over C&D in January; didn't back it up in a similar contest at Wolverhampton (9.5f, Tapeta) four weeks ago, appearing to take offence at an early bump, but she still wasn't beaten far; respected back here with cheekpieces replacing blinkers.

runners.name: Risen Again
runners.comment: Placed five times but now 0-11 and not progressing; blinkers on
runners.spotlight: Has shown ability and been placed five times, but now 0-11 and doesn't seem to be progressing; first-time blinkers join the hood on this occasion and they need to help him produce something extra.

runners.name: Imperial Cult
runners.comment: Won twice over 1m4f here last year; off five months but can go well fresh; considered
runners.spotlight: Won three times last year including twice over 1m4f here; returns from five months off, but his record after a break of 100 days or more reads 324 so fitness may not be an issue; considered.

runners.name: Crafter
runners.breeder: J Hanly, A Stroud & Skymarc Farm
runners.comment: Record over C&D reads 21242; another big effort seems likely
runners.spotlight: Record over C&D reads 21242, only going down by half a length here last month (Obsidian Knight back in sixth); back up 1lb but another big effort seems likely.

runners.name: Newfangled
runners.comment: Fine form in cheekpieces in second half of 2024, but off five months and no headgear today
runners.spotlight: In fine form in the second half of last year once the cheekpieces went on (312112) including a win over C&D, but he returns from five months off with the headgear missing; something to prove.

runners.name: Coolree
runners.comment: 2lb below last winning mark, but 0-10 on the AW so he does need to find a bit more
runners.spotlight: 2lb below last winning mark and may have needed the run on stable debut at Chelmsford (1m, Polytrack) 11 days ago, but now 0-10 on the AW so he does need to find a bit more; cheekpieces removed.

runners.name: Molly Valentine
runners.comment: Ended a 13-race losing run at Wolverhampton in December, but well held there last time
runners.spotlight: Took advantage of a falling mark when ending a 13-race losing run at Wolverhampton (9.5f, Tapeta) in December, but well held over the same C&D the following month; 79-day absence since then not a major issue, but not quite sure what to expect.

runners.name: Saturnalia
runners.owner: Ms H N Pinniger And Partner
runners.comment: Has been running consistently well in defeat lately, but a losing run of 15 is a concern
runners.spotlight: Course winner (7f) who has been running consistently well in defeat lately, as when fourth of eight at Wolverhampton (9.5f, Tapeta) last month (winner has gone in again three times since); this trip may suit him better, but a losing run of 15 is a concern.

stable_tour.quote: Having gelded him last summer he never made his racecourse debut until Lingfield in January when second over a mile. The drop back to 7f did the trick as next time out he won at Wolverhampton. He has run well in defeat since, notably when a neck second at Kempton. His last three runs, all on turf, have not been great but he is a solid horse and I am hoping that he can put those efforts behind him back at Newbury on Tuesday. I am looking for a nice run from him this week, but it could be that we have him wrong and he is a sprinter. 29-06-23

runners.name: Lincoln Legacy
runners.owner: G P S Heart Of Racing (Bloodstock) Ltd
runners.comment: 3-11 for previous yard but tailed off on stable debut 12 days ago; enough to prove
runners.spotlight: 3-11 for Charlie Johnston and 1lb lower than for her latest success at Newcastle (7f, Tapeta; first-time blinkers) in November; tailed off minus the headgear on stable debut back there (1m; first start since wind surgery) 12 days ago, which leaves her with enough to prove; blinkers are still missing.

quotes.race: JenningsBet Fillies' Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Like a lot of our horses that ran at Goodwood last time, Lincoln Legacy looks to have been better served by this faster ground. I thought she was in trouble at halfway but she picked up well out of the Dip - Jock Bennett, trainer's assistant.

runners.name: Love Your Work
runners.comment: 4lb higher then when winning at Chelmsford last time; no surprise if he again goes well
runners.spotlight: Rather in and out since returning to the AW in October, though he has managed to win twice including at Chelmsford (1m, Polytrack) this month; 4lb higher but no surprise if he again goes well.

quotes.race: Bombardier Golden Beer Handicap
quotes.quote: It's a unique surface so previous form at the course helps a lot. Love Your Work is declared for Friday and as long as he's all right, he'll run again - Tim Fitzgerald, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Home Of The Odds Boost Handicap
quotes.quote: Adam said go forward. Love Your Work did have a look, he was a bit lairy in front, but the blinkers have done the job for him. I knew I had to put on a strong gallop. My horse will be better the next time and probably even better dropped back to seven furlongs - Robbie Walsh, jockey.

runners.name: Mister Mojito
runners.comment: Probably needed last month's Kempton return having been gelded and undergone wind surgery
runners.spotlight: Won here (7f) last summer, but was off for 200 days having been gelded and undergone wind surgery when well held at Kempton (1m, Polytack; pulled hard) last month; needs to do better, but the run should have taken the fizz out of him and a tongue-tie is now given a go.

quotes.race: Download The Racecourse App Raceday Ready Handicap
quotes.quote: Mister Mojito is still improving. I was a little disappointed with him last time at Newmarket, I don't think the ground was an issue, I just think he ended up getting behind the wrong horse and tactically we got it wrong. He came out of the race really well and I would have been a little bit disappointed if he wasn't involved today. He doesn't like soft ground but other than that he's not let us down - Terry Kent, trainer, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: South Kensington
runners.comment: 0-8 and lightly raced since autumn 2023; best watched unless the market suggests otherwise
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden who was placed a couple of times over 7f on Tapeta for Hugo Palmer as a 2yo, but lightly raced since and has shown little including on stable debut at Southwell (7f, Tapeta) in December; best watched unless the market suggests otherwise.

runners.name: Francesi
runners.comment: C&D winner, but just 1-32 and he may need a stiffer test than this now
runners.spotlight: Sole success in 32 starts came over C&D as a 3yo; has a good record fresh so the 131-day absence isn't an issue, but quite apart from his unappealing strike-rate he may need a stiffer test than this now.

runners.name: Masterofgreygoose
runners.comment: 0-7 but has made the frame five times and may still may have a bigger performance in him
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden but hasn't had that many chances (0-7) and has made the frame five times; down another 3lb and still may have a bigger performance in him.

runners.name: Fat Gladiator
runners.comment: Has only raced ten times in almost four years, but the ability remains; interesting
runners.spotlight: Has only raced ten times (one win) despite making his debut in May 2021 and has always been with this stable; was returning from 709 days off when fourth of eight at Kempton (7f, Polytrack) 19 days ago, which suggests that the ability remains; interesting provided this doesn't come too soon.

runners.name: Rabinal
runners.owner: Mrs Heather Ann Chakko And Simon Dow
runners.comment: Best form has come here, but his record in Class 5 handicaps or higher reads 5864097
runners.spotlight: Best form has come here including all three wins (7f/1m); just 2lb above his last winning mark, but his record in Class 5 handicaps or higher reads 5864097 so he may again find a few too strong.

runners.name: River Alwen
runners.comment: Didn't seem suited by the drop to 1m at Chelmsford last time and this is even sharper
runners.spotlight: Took advantage of a declining mark at Chelmsford (1m2f, Polytrack) in November, but didn't seem suited by the drop to 1m on his reappearance there 16 days ago (behind Love Your Work); that would be a concern on this even sharper track.

quotes.race: Better Odds On Betfair Exchange Handicap
quotes.quote: River Alwen did well. He benefited from Newbury, he needed that run and was a bit fresh. He was dropped 2lb for that and this was a winnable race. I think ten furlongs is his trip but he will get more adaptable to middle-distances as he goes along. He should progress and improve again - Jamie Spencer, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's a very nice colt who ran a good race behind Fancy Man in the Listed Ascendant Stakes at Haydock in September. He is set to run at Newbury (3.25) on Friday. I've got a lot of time for him and he could step into Group company down the line but there are a lot of good handicaps he could be aimed at beforehand 16-04-21

runners.name: Taskheer
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner, but finished behind a couple of these at Chelmsford last time
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner including in a 0-50 classified event last month, but held back in handicap company at Chelmsford (1m, Polytrack) last time when behind a couple of these; may find this company a shade warm.

quotes.race: Follow At The Races On Twitter Handicap
quotes.quote: Taskeer stays a mile so the strong pace here suited him. He tries very hard and the sharp track at Lingfield last time got him beat - Kieran Shoemark, jockey.

1:47.race_name: Win Â£1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Fillies' Handicap

runners.name: Alcazan
runners.comment: The return to sprinting will help but she hasn't offered much in two runs back
runners.spotlight: As high in the weights as she's ever been aged seven off the back of three turf wins last year; the return to sprinting will help but she hasn't offered much in two runs back (said to have stopped quickly last time).

quotes.race: Read Katie Walsh On Betway Insider Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: We were umming and ahing over whether the drop back to six furlongs would suit, but Alcazan has enjoyed that and bowled along nicely. I did think at one point we were tapping a bit too soon but I managed to get a breather into her at the three-furlong pole and she's gone on again round the bend - Laura Coughlan, jockey.

runners.name: Baileys Jubilation
runners.owner: Baileys Horse Feeds (F H Nash Ltd)
runners.comment: Easier course again won't hurt under an experienced 5lb claimer; is shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Showed 6f to be fine off this mark when last seen and this easier course again won't hurt under experienced 5lb claimer Archie Young; is shortlisted back from four months off.

runners.name: So Sassy
runners.comment: Showed enough last autumn to warrant consideration, especially with Oisin Murphy booked
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to five winners who showed enough in maiden/novice company against her own sex last autumn to warrant consideration now handicapping, especially with Oisin Murphy booked.

runners.name: Spiritualism
runners.comment: Blinkers return, having been left off for her low-key comeback; ought to fare better
runners.spotlight: Made all when springing a surprise off 2lb lower at Kempton last autumn; the blinkers return today, having been left off for her low-key Southwell comeback early in the month, and she ought to fare better.

runners.name: Toughly
runners.comment: Pleasing handicap/Polytrack debut behind Handle With Care last time; open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Southwell win in January has been well advertised since and she made a pleasing handicap/Polytrack debut behind Handle With Care last time; yard has been going well of late and she's open to improvement.

runners.name: Handle With Care
runners.comment: Progressed with racing last summer and is entitled to have come on for Kempton fourth
runners.spotlight: Solid handicap debut, back from six months off, when having Toughly behind at Kempton recently; progressed with racing last summer and is entitled to have come on for her latest start.

runners.name: Beautiful Things
runners.comment: Has gone the wrong way for this yard, hanging left throughout last time
runners.spotlight: Patchy for George Scott and has gone the wrong way for this yard, hanging left throughout when finishing last behind two of these on her Kempton comeback.

runners.name: Commendation
runners.comment: The race didn't pan out her way last time and she won't mind going back up to 6f
runners.spotlight: Cheekpieces helped for her new yard when winning over 5f here off 4lb lower last month; the race didn't pan out her way last time and she won't mind going back up to 6f.

4:47.race_name: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Classified Stakes

runners.name: Avarice
runners.comment: Has C&D form; shaped as if retaining ability latest; of interest dropped to a classified
runners.spotlight: Sole AW win at Wolverhampton in 2022 but he acts well here; it's been a long road back from nearly two years off the track but he shaped a bit better at Wolverhampton recently when not getting the best of runs; interesting and worth a market check now qualified for this level.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden (Div II)
quotes.quote: He's a lovely genuine horse and does all the donkey work at home leading babies and younger horses. He wants 1m4f but the rain played to his strengths over that trip. Eventually he should make a proper jumper as there is a bit of class about him - assistant trainer Shane Lyons.

stable_tour.quote: He has been very disappointing as we thought we were buying a horse who would do much better than he has. It's his second season with us since coming over from Ireland and he's only won once. He has come down the ratings to 64 having been 84 on his first run for us. He's having a break now and will come back for a campaign on the all-weather this winter. 23-09-22

runners.name: Cosmic View
runners.comment: Chequered career but has C&D form and off the mark over 1m4f at Wolverhampton latest
runners.spotlight: Chequered career since close up in C&D novice as a 3yo but there has been the odd bit of encouragement and the drop in grade paid off when rallying to retake the lead inside the final furlong at Wolverhampton (1m4f; cheekpieces refitted) last month; should go well again.

runners.name: Dees Dream
runners.comment: 0-13 on AW but useful 1m4f third at Newcastle in January and she acts on Polytrack
runners.spotlight: 0-13 on AW but she showed useful form for the level when a close third to a good yardstick at Newcastle (1m4f) in January; this is her first Polytrack run for a year but she handles the surface; not far away.

runners.name: Foinix
runners.comment: Two 1m4f classified wins on turf in August; first run at this level since; can be involved
runners.spotlight: Two classified wins at about 1m4f on turf in August and this is his first run at the level since (apart from voided race two starts ago); has skipped between distances of late but has every chance back at this one.

quotes.race: Tips For Every Race At raceday-ready.com Classified Stakes
quotes.quote: Looking back at his form Foinix is well capable of having a sudden change in fortunes. He feels like he's really enjoying his racing. At Brighton he didn't look like a classified horse and didn't do so again today. He can just be a little bit gassy but he gets into a beautiful rhythm. He's definitely worth a go at further trips, but keep him where he is for now because he's doing nothing wrong - Joe Leavy, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Largo Bay
runners.comment: Four course wins; excuses for recent defeats; cheekpieces refitted; thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Four course wins, latest two over C&D and 1m5f early in 2024 (both with no headgear; cheekpieces refitted today); creditable return from break at Kempton and no blame attached to his third over C&D since; not far away.

runners.name: Mi Sueno
runners.comment: Two hurdle wins last spring but has gone off the rails since, including on turf/AW
runners.spotlight: Two hurdle wins last spring but he's gone off the rails since, in that discipline and on the Flat and AW; has plenty to prove at present.

runners.name: Nasim
runners.comment: Has run well at 1m3f in better races than this; trip query upped to 1m4f; classified debut
runners.spotlight: All three AW wins at 1m but he's run well in better races than this at 1m3f; whether he wants another furlong (first attempt) has yet to be proved but he might get away with it on his classified debut.

runners.name: National Health
runners.comment: Maiden; several good AW runs of late, 2nd to Cosmic View in February; path blocked latest
runners.spotlight: Maiden who's run some sound races in defeat of late, the race unfolding more in Cosmic View's favour when they were first and second at Wolverhampton (1m4f) in February; path blocked there last time; bang there.

runners.name: Walk The Moon
runners.comment: Solid Tapeta form this year but dropped out in sole Polytrack run, over C&D last summer
runners.spotlight: Dropped right out in his one Polytrack run, a C&D classified last summer, but he's been a presence in four Wolverhampton runs this year, finishing close up behind Cosmic View and National Health in February; chance if he can replicate that form back on this surface; yard also runs Honrado.

runners.name: Emperor Dream
runners.comment: Had very few chances but his form needs a boost on these unfavourable terms
runners.spotlight: Has had very few chances but his handicap form needs a boost now downgraded and the weights don't favour him.

runners.name: Honrado
runners.breeder: Lofts Hall Stud & Mrs C R Philipson

prev_owners.owner: Oti Racing, Lofts Hall Stud & Partner

runners.comment: Claims on 1m4f form here and on turf in 2024; ahead of Largo Bay over C&D in January
runners.spotlight: Maiden; comes into it on C&D second in January, when ahead of Largo Bay, and although that wasn't a true test he also has claims on his 1m4f form in 2024, over C&D and on turf; in the mix back at this trip.

runners.name: Sapphire Sirocco
runners.comment: Lightly raced; poorly positioned when well adrift here latest; probably capable of better
runners.spotlight: Hasn't had nearly as many chances as some and although well adrift of Honrado and Largo Bay over C&D in January she was never well positioned in a slowly run race; probably capable of better.

5:17.race_name: Weekly Â£5 Free Bet With BetUK Classified Stakes (Div I)

runners.name: Aeroplane Mode
runners.comment: 0-12 and only of interest if positive in the market
runners.spotlight: 0-12 and didn't shown much on his return from a year off at Wolverhampton (9.5f, Tapeta) 13 days ago; only of interest if positive in the market.

runners.name: Brinton
runners.comment: Consistent since returned to AW; slight stamina doubt, but should stay on this sharp track
runners.spotlight: Has proved most consistent since returning to the AW last September (4333132); slight question mark against her stamina over this far, but it should be within range on this sharp track; major player.

runners.name: Crazy Maisie
runners.breeder: Oghill House Stud & Joseph M Burke

prev_owners.owner: T Snaith, G White & Giggle Factor

runners.comment: Hasn't shown any worthwhile form in over a year; hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: 2-32 and hasn't shown any worthwhile form in over a year; hard to fancy.

quotes.race: Wear Your Poppy With Pride Handicap
quotes.quote: The original plan was to go to Kempton on the 20th, but when they put this extra fixture on it was a no-brainer to come. Crazy Maisie went hurdling last year on soft ground and she had such a hard race at Huntingdon. She just went backwards from then onwards. She had a holiday for two or three months and she's come back all good - Mark Hoad, trainer.

runners.name: Danehill Star
runners.comment: C&D winner, but he has finished behind Brinton on all three occasions they have met
runners.spotlight: Won a 0-58 handicap in first-time cheekpieces over C&D in January and a similar contest to this at Newcastle (1m, Tapeta) this month; shaped as though the return to this trip would suit when third of 11 at Wolverhampton (8.6f, Tapeta) a week ago, but he has finished behind Brinton on all three occasions they have met.

runners.name: Iftikhaar
runners.comment: Now 0-27 and has the widest draw
runners.spotlight: One of his better recent efforts when second of eight here (1m) last month (first and fifth have won since); stays at least this far, but is now 0-27 and has the widest draw.

runners.name: Laurentia
runners.comment: Six AW wins including three here; needs a good pace to run at, but she may well get it
runners.spotlight: All six wins have come on the AW including three here (1m/1m2f); ran well when second of 11 at Chelmsford (1m, Polytrack) 16 days ago given the trip would have been sharp enough, while she also ran into traffic; needs a good pace to run at but she may well get it; respected.

quotes.race: Play 4 To Win At Betway Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Laurentia probably had the run of the race. She's done really well this year. I'd hope she could win again. She's been very progressive - George Downing, jockey.

runners.name: Mr Trick
runners.comment: Each-way claims on form, but a record of 3-53 means that others are preferred for the win
runners.spotlight: Down to this level for the first time when second of nine at Wolverhampton (9.5f, Tapeta) last month; each-way claims on form, but a record of 3-53 and his wide draw means that others are preferred for the win; blinkers return.

quotes.race: Pertemps Handicap
quotes.quote: Mr Trick has taken his time and appreciated the cut in the ground. He's run up to his best - Ian Williams, trainer.

runners.name: Poles Apart
runners.comment: From a respected stable, but now 0-13 and stamina a big question over this far
runners.spotlight: From a respected stable, but now 0-13 and stamina a big question over this far.

runners.name: Roundabout Silver
runners.comment: Only once made the frame in seven starts on the AW; still has to prove he wants this far
runners.spotlight: Dual turf winner over 1m in 2022/23, but has only once made the frame in seven starts on the AW; still has to prove that he wants this far.

runners.name: The Ormer Gatherer
runners.comment: 0-18 under rules and has only been placed once; hard to make a case for him
runners.spotlight: 0-18 under rules (including five starts on Jersey) and has only been placed once; returns to the Flat after pulling up on stable/hurdles debut after 787 days off in October; hard to make a case after another absence.

runners.name: Venus Slipper
runners.comment: Made it 14th-time lucky in a 0-55 handicap over C&D last month; ought to go well again
runners.spotlight: Made it 14th-time lucky in a 0-55 handicap over C&D last month; the form is ordinary, but this is even weaker and she ought to go well again.

runners.name: Werenotreallyhere
runners.comment: Drops to this level for the first time, but latest efforts raise doubts
runners.spotlight: Drops to this level for the first time and would be a major player on the pick of his form from last year, but his last four efforts raise doubts as to whether he can capitalise; no headgear today.

3:17.race_name: Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap (Div I)

runners.name: Royal Jet
runners.comment: Handicapper quick to ease off but a first-time hood will need to make a difference
runners.spotlight: Heavy-ground novice winner for Andrew Balding as a 3yo who's struggled badly for two yards since; the handicapper's been quick to ease off but a first-time hood (worn blinkers once before) will need to make a difference.

runners.name: Mount Mogan
runners.comment: Landed a third course win when last seen in January; more on his plate off this mark
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent gelding who does most racing now over C&D and landed a third course win when last seen in January; that was a 0-50 classified event and he has more on his plate off this mark.

quotes.race: Win Â£2,000,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap
quotes.quote: Mount Mogan has come a long way down the handicap and has got himself into this grade. We always thought he was slightly better and hopefully that gets his confidence back and we can have some fun in the winter with him - Laura Mongan, trainer.

quotes.race: MansionBet Beaten By A Head Handicap
quotes.quote: Laura Mongan thought Mount Mogan would run well and she was right. They got him in good condition from Ed Walker I believe and he finished off his race very well - Jim Crowley, jockey.

quotes.race: Abacus Securities Handicap
quotes.quote: They didn't go quick and Mount Mogan got a nice position. His victory last time has given him a bit of confidence and hopefully he's still on the up  Luke Morris, jockey.

quotes.race: Unibet Extra Place Offers Every Day Handicap
quotes.quote: Mount Mogan has always shown a lot in the mornings but hasn't really fulfilled his potential on the track. The ability is there and he got a lovely trip round today and did everything right. Hopefully it gives him a bit of confidence where he can step forward from it  - Luke Morris, rider.

runners.name: Ya Rayah
runners.comment: Maiden who hung left a few times for Sean Woods; has been gelded and the market will guide
runners.spotlight: Maiden who hung left a few times for Sean Woods, mainly over a bit further, before being picked up for 5,000gns last autumn; has been gelded and the market will guide after five months off.

runners.name: Kessaar Power

prev_owners.owner: Paul Kwok, Angel Li & Orbital Racing Group

runners.comment: Likes Chelmsford and will be happier back on Polytrack but needs to bounce back
runners.spotlight: Infrequent winner who's done most recent racing over 1m; likes Chelmsford and will be happier back on Polytrack but needs to improve somewhat on his latest effort.

runners.name: Ashford Hill
runners.comment: Pulled hard from the outside stall here last time and is capable back at this lower level
runners.spotlight: 125-1 C&D winner for regular partner Isobelle Chalmers last November off this mark; pulled hard from the outside stall here last time (isn't the easiest) and is capable back at this lower level.

runners.name: Lord Danielson
runners.comment: Patchy record at best at beyond 6f; stall 10 isn't ideal for one happiest on the sharp end
runners.spotlight: Dual 6f Chelmsford winner in January who's been given a break since a below-par effort; has a patchy record at best at beyond 6f and stall 10 isn't ideal for one happiest on the sharp end.

runners.name: Blue Collar Lad
runners.comment: Returns from a break on a career-low mark having struggled in three runs in the winter
runners.spotlight: Returns from a short break on a career-low mark having struggled in three runs in the winter; won for cheekpieces first going on and again for them being refitted last autumn, so has that in his favour, and is well suited by switchback tracks.

stable_tour.quote: For a horse who was sourced for only 1,000gns at the Newmarket Sales [Book 4] he's done us proud. Ardad has made a fantastic start to his career and I don't think we will be able to afford any of his progeny this year at the sales. It is a very busy time for us in fact I remember last year we looked 430 horses for the sales and bought around 20, so you don't get these bargains without your research and we have a team of us that spend a lot of hours doing just that. We took him to Bath first time out where he won, not totally surprising as his work had been good. I remember asking the handicapper in the spring what rating he thought I would need to get in the 7f nursery at Glorious Goodwood so we planned on that as his big target. But Lady Luck deserted him in the race as after a furlong he clipped heals and almost fell over, only to regain his composure and finish with a right old flourish to be a fast finishing second. He would have got up in another ten strides. Jason Weaver mentioned it on TV how unlucky we were and what a big thing it would be for a small yard to win at such a prestigious meeting. He was fifth over 7f at Salisbury last week but he should get a mile in time as he's so laidback. 15-09-21

runners.name: Seas Of Elzaam
runners.comment: Doesn't always find as much as looks likely but he'll rightly be popular once more
runners.spotlight: Has been threatening in 0-50 company of late; hasn't won for a long time and doesn't always find as much as looks likely but he'll rightly be popular once more.

runners.name: Alyara
runners.owner: Lynn Cullimore Pete Ponting Joe Ponting
runners.comment: Needs to settle better; does most racing over further and has never found winning easy
runners.spotlight: Serial hard-puller who switches from a hood/cheekpieces to a first-time visor and needs to settle better; does most racing over further and has never found winning easy.

runners.name: Repartee
runners.breeder: Wansdyke Farms Ltd & J M Burke
runners.comment: Useful in his day but is inconsistent and poor now; again only holds outside claims
runners.spotlight: Useful in his day but is inconsistent and poor now; last two placed efforts have come round here but he again only holds outside claims.

quotes.race: Bombardier Golden Beer Carnarvon Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Repartee came into the race with pretty good form from his two-year-old days. He was declared for the Jersey Stakes at Royal Ascot but the ground went too soft and he was pulled out of the race. When I walked into the paddock I thought he looked a picture and the best-looking horse in the ring. He's a horse we've thought a lot of and from two to three he's done very well physically - Andrea Atzeni, rider.

quotes.race: Stratford Place Stud Breeds Group Winners ebfstallions.com Maiden Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Repartee has always been pretty talented. He works very well and it's nice to see him go and do that. He's still immature and he's going to improve massively. I'll speak to the owner but it's not all about Ascot - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a soft-palate operation, which will help him a lot, and we'll run him over 7f or a mile. He started off well last year and I still have plenty of faith in him. 11-05-21

5:47.race_name: Weekly Â£5 Free Bet With BetUK Classified Stakes (Div II)

runners.name: Big Narstie
runners.breeder: S A Stilvi Compania Financiera Et Al
runners.comment: Five wins over 7f/1m on the AW; hasn't shone in two previous goes over this far
runners.spotlight: Five wins over 7f/1m on the AW; looked as though he needed further when fifth of eight on stable debut at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta) 13 days ago, but he hasn't shone in two previous goes over this far.

quotes.race: Bombardier "March To Your Own Drum" Maiden Stakes
quotes.quote: Big Narstie has a great attitude and is still learning and did that nicely. Thanks to Phil Cunningham for keeping me on him after his run in France - Hayley Turner, jockey.

runners.name: Cherry Hill
runners.comment: Drops to this level for the first time, but this is her first attempt beyond 1m
runners.spotlight: 1-16 with her best AW form coming at Kempton; drops to this level for the first time, but she has been off for 101 days and this is her first attempt beyond 1m.

stable_tour.quote: I'm very happy with her. I stepped her up to a mile at Kempton on her penultimate start but she didn't quite get home, and the return to seven furlongs at the same track on Monday did the trick, just getting up by a neck. 21-09-23

runners.name: Fascinating Lips
runners.comment: 2-5 over C&D and drops to this level for the first time; high on the list back here
runners.spotlight: Losing run up to 13, but he is 2-5 over C&D and drops to this level for the first time; only found one too good at Wolverhampton (9.5f, Tapeta) three weeks ago and high on the list back here.

runners.name: Fullforward
runners.comment: 0-16 on the AW and this trip looks on the sharp side for him now
runners.spotlight: Mainly consistent since last summer and has finished runner-up in both previous starts down at this level; 0-16 on the AW, though, and this trip looks on the sharp side for him now; visor returns.

runners.name: Keen Interest
runners.comment: Won a handicap at Newcastle in November, but not at the same level since
runners.spotlight: Won a handicap at Newcastle (1m2f, Tapeta) in November, but not at the same level since; needs the returning cheekpieces to give him a boost.

runners.name: Limmortale

prev_owners.owner: Ms Ciara Doyle & M C Grassick

runners.comment: Runner-up on stable debut last time, but now 1-17 and more is needed
runners.spotlight: Formerly trained in Ireland; finished second of nine on stable debut at Wolverhampton (8.6f, Tapeta) a week ago, but that was a steadily run affair and he is now 0-17; more will be needed in the returning cheekpieces.

runners.name: Rainbow Sign
runners.comment: Seems best at shorter while a record of 2-49 does sound a note of caution
runners.spotlight: Only beaten a head over C&D last summer, but he does seem best at shorter while a record of 2-49 also sounds a note of caution.

runners.name: Sir Laurence Graff

prev_owners.owner: White Birch Farm, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor

runners.comment: Return here looks to be a positive (0122); shortlist material
runners.spotlight: Finished behind Fascinating Lips when fourth of eight at Wolverhampton (9.5f, Tapeta) three weeks ago, but the return here looks to be a positive (0122); shortlist material.

runners.name: Sun Festival
runners.comment: Twice second at Wolverhampton before finishing lame last time; each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in his first two starts back down at this level at Wolverhampton (9.5f, Tapeta) earlier in the year, but was found to be lame there four weeks ago; each-way claims at least if bouncing back.

runners.name: Sunset In Paris
runners.comment: Four wins at this level last year including two over C&D; better effort last time; player
runners.spotlight: Won four times at this level last year including twice over C&D; suggested a return to form when fourth of nine at Wolverhampton (9.5f, Tapeta) last month (just behind a subsequent winner) and a player if building on it.

runners.name: Vitruvian Dawn
runners.comment: Hasn't beaten many in five outings over 1m-1m5f on the AW; hard to recommend
runners.spotlight: Hasn't beaten many in five outings over 1m-1m5f on the AW, never starting at less than 33-1; hard to recommend despite the drop in grade.

3:47.race_name: Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap (Div II)

runners.name: Galel
runners.comment: This easy 7f down to 0-55 company for the first time looks ideal; watch the market
runners.spotlight: Maiden who again finished well held last time and has landed the outside stall back from five weeks off; is usually dropped in, though, and this easy 7f down to 0-55 company for the first time looks ideal; watch the market.

runners.name: Neptune Legend
runners.comment: Has enjoyed a consistent start to the year and looks set to go well once more
runners.spotlight: Dual course winner who's adaptable as regards distance and tactics; has enjoyed a consistent start to the year, albeit he's been turned over as favourite a few times, and looks set to go well once more.

quotes.race: Ian Angry Anderson Celebration Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Neptune Legend was very happy out in front. Hopefully he can build on it as he's definitely grown since earlier in the year. He was in control and he's a lovely type, which bodes well for later in his career-Oishin Murphy, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: I thought he would need the run last week when making his debut at Nottingham and I was right to a degree, but he still ran a terrific race and had he not run green he could have won. He had a good blow afterwards and I am sure there is an awful lot of improvement to come. We will see how he builds on that run but Plan A at this stage is to win a maiden and then possibly go for the Coventry, but there is a lot of water to pass under the bridge before that. 29-05-21

runners.name: Ravensbourne
runners.comment: Has run well here before and is drawn to attack but others make more appeal
runners.spotlight: Has struggled since making all at Chelmsford in January; has run well here before and is drawn to attack but others make more appeal.

runners.name: Porfin
runners.comment: Has run poorly a few times since forced out of 0-50 company; has other pace around him
runners.spotlight: Made all over C&D in January but has run poorly a few times since forced out of 0-50 company; has other pace around him and needs to bounce back.

runners.name: Bear To Dream
runners.comment: Two fair efforts back from a break, without much luck, and an easy 7f is fine; considered
runners.spotlight: Two fair efforts back from a break, without having much luck, and an easy 7f is fine; is back on her last winning mark and one to consider.

quotes.race: Billy Wilber 80th Stakes Handicap
quotes.quote: I was a bit worried about the ground this morning because I was here yesterday when we had all that rain. Bear To Dream hadn't run for a while so I was worried about her getting caught out on that tacky ground, but she was obviously fitter than I thought she was. She's very straightforward. She does plenty at home and Kaiya's [Fraser] has given her a great ride. That's his first winner for us and we've been using him for a bit. He has a real nice way of riding - Michael Attwater, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing

runners.name: Mashaan
runners.comment: Previous C&D winner who arrives in form; remains consistent and a case could be made
runners.spotlight: Well drawn for one who usually has plenty of use made of him and is a previous C&D winner who arrives in form; remains consistent enough and a case could be made.

stable_tour.quote: We got him from Richard Fahey as an 18-race maiden, but the change of scenery certainly did him some good as he won at the second time of asking and followed that up three weeks later at Chelmsford. Those were both on the all-weather, but he will be just as effective on the turf, especially with a bit of cut in the ground. He pings the gate like a greyhound, but last time out at Doncaster, back on turf, they had not watered, and it was good to firm which was no good to him. To bring out the best in him he needs some ease on a turning track. As for trip, I think he's at his best over 7f on a turning track like Chester, or alternatively a stiff 6f on a straight course. 04-05-22

runners.name: Outreach
runners.comment: AW wins have come at Wolverhampton and he's high in the weights now
runners.spotlight: AW wins have come at Wolverhampton and he's high in the weights after going in there off 4lb lower last month; often races wide and may again from this stall, especially with other pace on his inner.

runners.name: Comedian Leader

prev_owners.owner: Aj Racing G Kelleway N Sowerby D Beedle

runners.comment: Could well have this set up for her if she gets the breaks from a wide stall; player
runners.spotlight: Has only won once in the last two years and has done her racing since returning from wind surgery over further; has looked in decent nick, though, and this could well be set up for her if she gets the breaks from a wide stall off a career-low mark.

runners.name: Edergoles Gift
runners.comment: The blinkers come off and, despite a further 3lb drop, she's hard to make a case for
runners.spotlight: Won a 0-50 classified event over C&D last summer but struggled during the winter; the blinkers come off again and, despite a further 3lb drop in the weights, she's hard to make a case for.

runners.name: Regal Glory
runners.comment: Had plenty of chances in weak races; only holds each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Only seen sporadically in recent times and has had plenty of chances in weak races; ran as well as could have been expected having pulled hard last time, but only holds each-way claims.

runners.name: Mr Baloo
runners.comment: Made it 4-11 on AW with last-gasp win at Newcastle 11 days ago; respected off 2lb higher
runners.spotlight: Dual turf winner, who made it 4-11 on AW when scoring at Newcastle (7f, Tapeta) 11 days ago; that was a last-gasp win but he did well to overcome trouble and is only 2lb higher now back up in trip; respected.

runners.name: Way To Dubai
runners.comment: Last win was in Germany in 2023 and he needs to find more back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Useful in Germany in his youth but failed to win in 13 starts for Charlie Fellowes and was a well-held third on recent stable debut at Southwell (7f, Tapeta); that was after a break and this return to 1m is no problem but others are more convincing.

runners.name: High Point
runners.comment: Record of 3-6 on turf but he's been well held in three AW runs; down the list
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-6 on turf but he's been well held in three AW runs, the latest on stable debut at Chelmsford (1m) last month; should benefit from that run but he's untried on Tapeta and this is competitive; down the list.

quotes.race: British EBF Ruby Anniversary Nursery Handicap (Sire And Dam Restricted Race)
quotes.quote: High Point ran a nice race at Windsor last time and we were quite confident coming in as he is a galloping type. He could get a mile and three quarters next year - George Downing, rider.

runners.name: Paradoxical
runners.comment: Improver who has won here in his last four starts; big player under another penalty
runners.spotlight: Has won six times on AW since December, including at this track in his last four starts; has a penalty for his narrow success over C&D last Monday but he reeled in a well-handicapped rival and this tough 4yo is open to more progress; key player.

runners.name: Hitched
runners.comment: Four wins during the winter but he was disappointing over C&D ten days ago
runners.spotlight: Hold-up performer who enjoyed a good winter, winning four times and going up 20lb in the weights; had an excuse in a non-event over 1m4f on his penultimate run but he was disappointing back over C&D ten days ago and has bit to prove after that heavy defeat.

runners.name: Hows The Guvnor
runners.comment: Unexposed on AW and he needs checking in market on return for new yard
runners.spotlight: Just one win from ten starts for Clive Cox but he's well treated on his best form and was a creditable fourth at Newbury (1m, good to firm) in final run last summer; still unexposed on AW and needs checking in the market on return for new yard (changed hands for 11,500gns).

runners.name: Caelan
runners.comment: On dangerous mark and he caught the eye of the stewards at Southwell last time; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Justified favouritism in 9.4f handicap here for Marco Botti last February; hasn't matched that since but he caught the eye of the stewards at Southwell (1m3f) last time and is now 3lb lower than for his win; could be dangerous back in trip.

quotes.race: Best Racing Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap
quotes.quote: Caelan is still a big, raw horse. He won first-time out but ended up being quite immature and he was running a bit free but today he's done everything the right way round, although he wasn't doing a tap in front. He's taken well to all-weather surfaces but I don't see why he won't be just as effective on the grass - Hollie Doyle, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Eden Storm
runners.comment: Dual course winner but both wins were in 2023 and he didn't really fire over C&D last time
runners.spotlight: Dual 7f winner at this track but both were in 2023; on a dangerous mark and was a close fourth at Newcastle (1m) on penultimate run but he didn't really fire over C&D since; needs to step up; cheekpieces added.

7:30.race_name: Weekly Â£5 Free Bet With BetUK Handicap

runners.name: Many A Star
runners.comment: Three 6f wins this year and he didn't get any luck in a Class 2 last time; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Three 6f wins this year, the first over C&D and last two at Southwell; finished down the field in last two runs but he didn't get any luck at Southwell last time and this is a big drop back in grade; possibilities.

quotes.race: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap
quotes.quote: Many A Star did it well. With a horse of his age, especially at this sort of distance, when they're in good form it's best to keep rolling. He's a big horse and is taking his racing well. This track does really suit him as it gives him a long time to wind up. They went a strong gallop and he picked up a bit quicker than I thought he would, we were in front plenty long enough, but he's very game and it's a credit to Jamie [Osborne, trainer] and the team for keeping him in such good form - William Carver, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Coral Stewards' Sprint Handicap (Consolation Race For The Stewards' Cup)
quotes.quote: The ground is challenging and did not really suit Many A Star but he ran really well. He struggled a bit to get out as they all came in very tight and when he got out he did not pick up as we'd have liked but on this ground the softer-ground horses did better - Jeffrey Hobby, owner.

quotes.race: Coral Stewards' Sprint Handicap (Consolation race for The Stewards' Cup)
quotes.quote: The last time Many A Star ran at Newmarket six weeks ago there was no pace and he didn't run any race. We just thought after that race that he'd run a few times and decided to give him a break and it's all come to fruition. He gained weight during the break and he's looking better now. We might look at the Ayr Gold Cup - Oliver Cole, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Events At Ascot Handicap
quotes.quote: I think Many A Star is quite a nice horse. He has a bit of confidence now and I think he has come on from his last run at Goodwood. He stripped a bit fitter today and will probably go for a bigger handicap, but he loved that ground - Oliver Cole, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Seadeer Handicap
quotes.quote: Many A Star is a shell of a horse and will be nice next year. He enjoyed the ground - Andrea Atzeni, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He'll win again soon. Although he's won on soft ground, I think he's much better on a quicker surface. He'll either go back to the all-weather or we'll find quick ground for him. He's well capable with conditions in his favour. He'll probably drop in the handicap and will be tough to beat. 11-09-24

runners.name: Gressington
runners.comment: Ran well on reappearance last spring and he's still unexposed on AW; one to keep an eye on
runners.spotlight: A few costly defeats last year but he also won twice including at Redcar (6f, good to firm) on his penultimate run; returns after 170 days off but he ran well on his reappearance last spring and he's still unexposed on AW; one to keep an eye on back in trip.

quotes.race: At The Races App Form Study Restricted Novice Stakes (No More Than 3 Runs) (Bands B-D) (GBB)(Div II)
quotes.quote: Gressington was green in the preliminaries and he will improve a bundle. It was a nice debut he can improve from and I feel there were some smart types in the race, so hopefully the form has a bit of substance to it - Ed Bethell, trainer.

runners.name: Gunfighter
runners.comment: Still above his last winning mark and has something to prove back at 6f for new yard
runners.spotlight: Dual AW winner but he didn't see much action last year and his last run was a well-held fifth of seven at Chester (7f, good) in June; left Hugo Palmer for 16,000gns since; still above his last winning mark and has something to prove back sprinting after 268 days off; cheekpieces removed.

stable_tour.quote: This colt was extremely well bought at the Deauville breeze-up and after some encouraging work he made a lovely start at Newbury when third to Sketch over 6f. I think that was a nice race and he came out of it well. I sent him to Salisbury last week for his second run and he ran very well for a long way before tiring in the final furlong. He's better than that and will be winning sooner rather than later. 17-08-23

runners.name: Blind Beggar
runners.comment: Plenty of good runs since October and he's respected back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Six-time winner split between turf and AW; last success was 12 months ago but he's been placed several times since October including a near miss over C&D four runs back; usually races prominently and he's respected back up in trip.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him at the October sales from Ger Lyons' yard with one win to his name. I've given him three runs on the all-weather since he arrived and he has won two of them at Southwell and Chelmsford. The most recent was six weeks ago and I've deliberately put him away now with a turf campaign in mind. He's effective over 5f and 6f and is up to a mark of 84, which looks quite workable. He's well capable of winning off that and hopefully improving some more. 22-03-23

runners.name: Twilight Romance
runners.comment: Sole win was as a 2yo but he was an eyecatcher over C&D last time; in the mix
runners.spotlight: His only win came in a York maiden as a 2yo but he has some useful handicap form to his name and was an eyecatcher over C&D (fifth of ten) 16 days ago; continues to edge down the weights and he looks interesting on this drop back in grade.

quotes.race: Reg Griffin Appreciation ebfstallions.com Maiden Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: The Haydock race Twilight Romance ran in worked out well. He looked a little bit green there and still looked as though he would improve further today. We'll probably work back from the 300,000GBP sales race here in August - Sean Quinn, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I like him. He ran very well in a good race at Haydock first time out last year, then won impressively at York. He was third favourite for the sales race at the Ebor meeting but got very upset in the preliminaries and had run his race before the stalls opened. We decided to geld him and put him away and I wouldn't be surprised if he built on that York win this year. He's one for the good three-year-old sprint handicaps. 20-03-24

runners.name: Ziggys Condor
runners.comment: Ended a lengthy losing run when making all at Southwell; respected off 3lb higher
runners.spotlight: His first win was on debut in July 2023 and his second was when making all in a first-time visor at Southwell (6f) last month; back up 3lb but his confidence should be boosted after that brave win; shortlisted.

runners.name: Supreme King
runners.comment: Has won two of his last five starts and he was as good as ever at Kempton (6f) last time
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-33 but he's won two of his last five starts including at Kempton (6f, Polytrack) 19 days ago; up 4lb but he was as good as ever last time and he still looks feasibly treated; respected.

runners.name: American Bay
runners.comment: Still unexposed on AW but he needs to find more on return for new yard
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the ninth attempt when landing a 6f Redcar novice in September but he couldn't pose a serious threat back in a handicap at Chelmsford the following month; left Harry Charlton for 30,000gns since; still unexposed on AW but he needs to find more on return for new yard.

runners.name: Brazilian Rose
runners.comment: Record of 4-10 on AW and she had a near miss at Southwell last time; interesting contender
runners.spotlight: Ten of 11 runs have been on AW and she's won four, including three in a row at Newcastle (6f, Tapeta) in January; disappointing at Lingfield last month but she bounced back with a near miss at Southwell (7f) 11 days ago and is only 1lb higher on this drop back in trip; interesting.

runners.name: Jungle Land
runners.breeder: G H S Bloodstock & J C Bloodstock
runners.comment: 0-6 in handicaps and has tough draw back on AW on his return; down the list
runners.spotlight: Won 6f Redcar maiden last May but he's 0-6 in handicaps and was well held at Nottingham when last seen in November; now back at 6f after a break but he's drawn wide and others are more convincing; cheekpieces removed.

runners.name: Rebel Path
runners.breeder: S A S U Ecurie Des Monceaux Et Al
runners.comment: Two wins during the winter but wasn't at his best last time and he has a tough draw here
runners.spotlight: Two 6f wins at Chelmsford during the winter but his form can be up and down and he wasn't at his best at Chelmsford last time; now back up in trip but he needs to raise his game and stall 11 could make things tough.

6:30.race_name: Win Â£1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap (GBB-plus Race)

runners.name: Tuscan Star
runners.comment: Ran green in sole 2yo run but he's 3-3 this year and is open to more progress; big player
runners.spotlight: Too green to do himself justice in one turf run as a 2yo but he's found stacks of improvement with three wins on AW this year; up another 4lb after his handicap debut win at Kempton (1m3f) but he was strong at the finish and is open to progress on this step up to 1m4f; leading contender.

runners.name: Kate Oriley
runners.comment: Won here in November and she looks interesting now upped to 1m4f on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Siblings include her connections' Ascot Gold Cup winner Big Orange; showed promise in her first two runs in the autumn before a last-gasp win over 8.6f here in November; returns after a break but she looks on a fair opening mark and should have more to offer on this step up to 1m4f; interesting contender on handicap debut.

quotes.race: Know Your Limits With BetMGM Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Kate O'Riley is a smart filly. I spoke to Mr [Michael] Bell and he said to jump out to make it and if you don't jump great just slot in somewhere and ride a race. Turning for home she wasn't doing anything quick and the front two got away from me but she dug deep. I think a step up in trip would be major for her and there's a lot more to come - Jack Doughty, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Magna Gee Gee
runners.comment: Won on handicap debut here in November but he's not gone on from that in two runs since
runners.spotlight: Improved form on handicap debut when scoring here (9.4f) in December but that was a narrow success and he's not gone on from that in two runs over 1m3f since; still unexposed after only six starts but he needs to kick on again to defy this mark.

runners.name: Ray Gun
runners.comment: Kempton winner who went close at Southwell (1m4f) last Saturday; respected up 2lb
runners.spotlight: Justified support on handicap debut at Kempton (1m4f) last month and he's finished second in both runs since including a close call at Southwell last Saturday; up another 2lb but his penultimate run was over C&D and he's respected back at this track.

5:30.race_name: Â£30 In Free Bets With BetUK EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Queen All Star
runners.comment: Win and good third in her two 2yo runs and she sets the standard on return; key player
runners.spotlight: Made a good start when justifying support at Windsor (6f, good to firm) last August and she found improvement when a front-running third under penalty at Goodwood three weeks later; returns after 213 days off but she sets the standard and should be fine on this drop to 5f; key player.

runners.name: Art Of Fox
runners.comment: Went off too fast on recent 7f debut and he looks interesting on this drop in trip
runners.spotlight: Mehmas gelding out of a Group-placed 5f/6f 2yo winner (RPR 95), well-held sixth of eight on his debut here (7f) 16 days ago but he went off too fast in that race and it wouldn't be a surprise if he took a major step forward on this drop in trip; one to keep an eye on.

runners.name: Our Planet
runners.comment: Showed promise on Kempton debut (7f) in October and he needs watching in market on return
runners.spotlight: 220,000euros yearling; faded into sixth of 12 on Kempton debut (7f) in October but that was behind a useful rival and he wasn't beaten far; gelded since and now drops to 5f on his return but yard is in good form and he needs watching in market.

runners.name: Alondra
runners.comment: Regressive form as a 2yo and has something to prove switched to AW on her return
runners.spotlight: Made a promising start when a 2l fifth at Newmarket (6f, good) last May but she was well held in her last three juvenile runs including a nursery; still early days but has something to prove now switched to AW after seven months off.

runners.name: Bint Elnadim Star
runners.comment: Plenty to like on paper and needs a close look on debut; owner also runs Queen All Star
runners.spotlight: Third foal; closely related to 6f winner Hello Queen (including AW; RPR 89); dam 5f/5.5f winner (including Listed; 101), half-sister to useful 5f/6f winner Red Pike and Listed-placed 5f 2yo winner Dom Carlos; plenty to like on paper and she needs a close look on debut; owner is also represented by Queen All Star.

runners.name: Hyzenthlay Rah
runners.comment: 3,500gns yearling; has fair standard to aim at on debut and is best watched
runners.spotlight: 3,500gns yearling; half-sister to five winners including Sea Chariot (7f/1m including AW; RPR 86) and If I Say So (French 5.5f-7f including 2yo AW; 75); dam 6f 2yo/7f winner (96), out of Listed-placed 1m/1m2f winner; has fair standard to aim at on debut and is best watched.

runners.name: Vamp
runners.comment: Showed ability on her Kempton debut (6f) last summer; needs checking in market on comeback
runners.spotlight: 22-1 for her Kempton debut (6f, AW) last June but she ran well for a long way before fading into a 3l sixth of 11; returns after a lengthy absence but that initial form is not far off the standard here and she's one to keep an eye on.

stable_tour.quote: I like this filly but she won't be out again for a while. 18-09-24

6:00.race_name: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap

runners.name: Wannabe Brave
runners.comment: Four AW wins last year and he's respected back on Tapeta on his return
runners.spotlight: Four wins on AW in 2024 and he ended last year with a clear second behind an improver at Chelmsford (1m6f); returns after 165 days off but he still looks on a workable mark and is respected back on Tapeta.

runners.name: Green Team
runners.comment: Bounced back with a strong-finishing win here (1m4f) last Saturday and he's a key player
runners.spotlight: Just two wins from 33 starts but latest was a strong-finishing success over 1m4f here last Saturday; that was by a neck but he's only 2lb higher here and is a big player if he can repeat the form back up in trip.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Green Team had a bit of a hold-up with a little problem with a foot and we gave him time. I'm not sure if he'll run again this season, he's going to be a lovely horse over ten furlongs next year - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

runners.name: Show No Fear
runners.comment: Emphatic win at Newcastle (2m) last month but was disappointing back there last time
runners.spotlight: Hit a personal best with his dominant display at Newcastle (2m, Tapeta) last month but he was last of six on his return visit 12 days ago; still looks feasibly treated on his penultimate form but he's hard to predict and needs to bounce back again after that last run; cheekpieces are removed and visor returns.

runners.name: Sea Appeal
runners.comment: Returns after a long absence and he's probably best watched on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Runner-up off 4lb higher over C&D on his last start but that was back in July 2023 and he now returns for a new yard after a long absence; probably best watched.

quotes.race: Treo Eile Retraining Ireland's Racehorses Handicap
quotes.quote: Sea Appeal is going to fill out and grow into that frame so you don't know where he'll stop. He's a real stayer, once I got to the front and got to dictate the race I didn't really have any worries. At home he could go as many laps as you want as he just loves galloping. He has a lovely big stride and he had no issue with the trip - Robbie Colgan, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He came to us from Sheila Lavery in the spring and got off the mark for us on his third run, a 1m5Â½f handicap at Chelmsford. Last time out at Goodwood in the 2m4Â½f handicap he was travelling very well at the top of the hill, but when they come down the hill, at the steepest part of the track, he lost his position and by the time he had gathered himself up it was too late. We will not run him on gradients like that again and will look for something on a flat track next. He is in good heart and can win again soon. 15-08-22

runners.name: Incan Empire
runners.comment: Very lightly raced 4yo but he needs improvement on this step up to 1m6f
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced 4yo but he's not made an impact switched to handicaps in last two runs including a well-held fourth here (1m4f) last month; dropped another 2lb but he needs improvement at this new trip.

runners.name: Fashionelle
runners.comment: Hurdle and Flat winner who was placed over C&D last time; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Won over hurdles (2m4f) for Fergal O'Brien last September and made a winning debut for this yard at Wolverhampton (9.4f, Tapeta) in January; hasn't really gone on from that since but her latest third at Southwell (1m6f) was a respectable effort and she's still unexposed on the Flat; not ruled out.

runners.name: Shelbourne
runners.comment: Has patchy profile but he's on a workable mark and needs watching in market on return
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-11 and has a patchy profile but he's versatile trip-wise and was a close third at Kempton (1m, AW) on his penultimate run last year; returns after 173 days off but he's well drawn back on Tapeta and needs watching in market.

stable_tour.quote: He can be his own worst enemy at times and can be quite aggressive in his racing, so I'd just love to see him relax. It's a problem in that he looks like he could win a race over six furlongs but I just know he needs a mile if he'd only settle. We'll wait for the grass and look for a stiff six furlongs or easy seven furlongs, and I'm very confident he'll be able to win a couple of races. In the process, he might mature a little bit and give us that chance to go further with him. 29-03-24

runners.name: Straight A
runners.comment: Dual course winner who went close off this mark at Southwell latest; interesting contender
runners.spotlight: Two of his four wins have been at this track and latest was over 8.6f in January; creditable efforts in three of his four runs since including a close third at Southwell (7f) last time; on unchanged mark back at this track and he's an interesting contender.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C/D) (EBF Qual') (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Straight A is such a baby. It's nice because he's not had a hard race and he's learnt a lot. Hopefully he'll take a step forward for that. He's been showing a lot at home and he really improved from his debut at Leicester - Hayley Turner, rider.

runners.name: Bobby Joe Leg
runners.comment: 16-time AW winner who has scored at Newcastle (7f) in last two runs; strongly respected
runners.spotlight: 16-time AW winner who has scored at Newcastle (7f) in his last two starts and latest was 17 days ago; up another 4lb but he remains feasibly treated and is strongly respected back at this track.

stable_tour.quote: A winner of 14 races for us, he's been in the form of his life this winter. He was placed off a mark of 71 and he's never won off a mark that high. He was in such good form last season I was expecting a disappointing one this year, because when you've come up you have to come down again, usually, but he's been running so well. My Mum and Dad bred him, so he's obviously quite special and he's been knocking about here for a long time. He's picked us up some of that Arc bonus the last two winters and has been a tremendous family servant. He ran at Newcastle on Tuesday evening and finished fifth. 17-04-24

runners.name: Thapa Vc
runners.comment: Nine-time AW winner but he's been well held last twice and has tough draw
runners.spotlight: Nine-time AW winner who had a near miss at Lingfied (7f) in December but he's been well held in his last two runs and latest was over C&D; bit to prove again and he has a tough draw.

quotes.race: Aalberts IPS Pegler Xpress Handicap
quotes.quote: Thapa Vc is quite a tricky ride, he's got to be produced right, and Jim is just class - Mark Rimell, trainer.

runners.name: Chifa
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late J P Carrington
runners.comment: Five-time C&D winner but he missed last year and has something to prove after 472 days off
runners.spotlight: Five of his seven wins have been over C&D but he missed last year and now makes his comeback after 472 days off; has something to prove and he's had another wind op since his last run.

runners.name: Gdaay
runners.comment: Well treated on his best form last year and was a creditable fourth at Kempton last month
runners.spotlight: His last AW win was in November 2022 but he's well treated on his best form last year and was a creditable fourth at Kempton (7f, Polytrack) last month; could be dangerous.

runners.name: City Cyclone
runners.comment: Two C&D wins in January and was runner-up at Kempton last time; respected
runners.spotlight: Raised his form to a new level when winning twice over C&D in January; held in last three runs but he ran right up to his best when second at Kempton last time and he's respected back at this track.

runners.name: Ash Wednesday
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs D R Guest & Mr & Mrs Jpm Main
runners.comment: Improver who has won four of his last five including over C&D latest; big player again
runners.spotlight: 4yo who has won four of his last five starts including when beating an in-form rival over C&D last Monday; has a penalty for that success but he's now 3-4 at this track and is open to more improvement; big player.

runners.name: Rebelsontherun
runners.breeder: Lynn Lodge Stud & Pier House Stud
runners.comment: Lost his way in Ireland and has lots to prove on return for new yard; equipment removed
runners.spotlight: Won on AW at Dundalk (dead-heat) last February but he's had only three runs since and has struggled in all of them; changed hands for 1,000gns in October and has lots to prove on return for new yard; equipment removed.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Handicap
quotes.quote: It probably suited Rebelsontherun, the way the race unfolded. I was able to get rolling early and it took a bit of time to get into gear but once I passed the furlong pole, he was in top gear and hit the line well. I thought I was up myself at the line but we got the win, that's the main thing - Jamie Powell, jockey.

runners.name: Zu Run
runners.comment: Won off reduced mark over C&D in Ocotober and has run some good races since; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Scored off a reduced mark over C&D in October and he's run several good races since including when runner-up here on his penultimate start; remains well treated on old form and he's not ruled out back at this track.

quotes.race: Ire-Incentive, It Pays To Buy Irish Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: It all happened a bit too quickly for Zu Run on his debut at Salisbury over the six furlongs. He missed the break and got unbalanced at times but I felt that he hit the line well enough for an extra furlong to help him and that's exactly what happened here. He showed a good attitude to the line and it's nice that he's taken a good step forward from that first experience - David Probert, jockey.

runners.name: Harbour Vision
runners.comment: Veteran who won twice over C&D in November but has mixed record since; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Veteran who won twice over C&D in November but he has a mixed record since and was well held here 16 days ago; still 5lb higher than for his last success and others are more persuasive.

quotes.race: Stay Safe Players With BetMGM Handicap
quotes.quote: Harbour Vision knows his way round here better than all of us! He jumped well enough but there was plenty of pace and he really settled for me. The gap opened up on the inside and he was away - Taryn Langley, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

8:00.race_name: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Handicap

runners.name: Gis A Sub
runners.comment: Struggled in his final two runs last year and has something to prove after six months off
runners.spotlight: Ended a long losing run when scoring off 1lb higher at Ripon (6f) last July but he struggled in his final two runs last year; still unexposed on AW but he's hard to predict and has something to prove after six months off.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Gimcrack Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Goodwood was a cock-up, and it was my fault, but Gis A Sub has run a great race today. He has a huge stride and I told Kevin to let him use it. He did everything right and showed he's a very good horse. We've already had a board meeting and decided to wait until October and the Criterium de Maisons-Laffitte, a race we've won before - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Spindrifter Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Gis A Sub is still a bit babyish and was half pulling up in front. He'll be a better horse when getting a lead in a better race. I think there's an awful lot to come from him and races like the Gimcrack would definitely be on the agenda - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was a very talented two-year-old who then found it hard when he was set some big tasks last year. He's grown and strengthened again over the winter and is back down to a very workable mark now. It would be good to see him in the big Saturday handicaps. 03-05-23

This fellow has plenty of ability as he showed last year when second in the Gimcrack Stakes, but unfortunately he tends to hold a lot back for himself. He has been a bit disappointing this season but has an entry in the Commonwealth Cup and I think we will fit him with cheekpieces to try to encourage him to put his best foot forward. 15-06-22

runners.name: Southbank
runners.owner: David N Reynolds &  C D Watkins

prev_owners.owner: Qatar Racing Limited & China Horse Club International Ltd

runners.comment: Won at Chelmsford in December and he had a tough task there last time; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Recorded his fourth AW win when scoring at Chelmsford (6f) in December; three placed runs followed and he had a tough task behind a resurgent rival who put in a dominant display at Chelmsford last time; still on a workable mark and has possibilities if this sets up for his closing style.

runners.name: Shamardia
runners.comment: Clear second at Chelmsford and has claims if she can back that up off an unchanged mark
runners.spotlight: Both wins were in September including over C&D; mixed form since her last success but was a clear second at Chelmsford (7f, Polytrack) last time and has claims if she can back that up off an unchanged mark.

runners.name: Radiant Angel
runners.comment: Made his breakthrough over C&D last month and a 3lb rise looks fair; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 12th attempt when coming from the rear to land a C&D handicap last month; up 3lb but he remains well treated on his best form and should get a decent tow into this race; shortlisted.

runners.name: Beaumadier

prev_owners.owner: Paul Cullen & Joseph E Keeling & E J Dwyer & M C Grassick

runners.comment: Record of 1-20 and was in rear over 5f here last time; headgear reapplied
runners.spotlight: Well backed when winning at Newcastle (5f) for Daragh Bourke in January, but he's been up and down since and was only eighth of nine here last time; should be fine on this step back up in trip but he's now 1-20 and others are more convincing; headgear back on.

runners.name: Papa Dont Preach

prev_owners.owner: Kevin Frost Racing Club & David Orr

runners.comment: Has ordinary strike-rate but he's gone close over C&D and at Chelmsford in last two runs
runners.spotlight: Has ordinary strike-rate of 3-43 but he's come from off the pace to go close over C&D and at Chelmsford (6f) in his last two starts; remains well handicapped off 2lb lower than for his last win in October and he's respected.

runners.name: Carmarthen
runners.comment: One win from 11 starts and has something to prove after six months off
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D for Jack Channon last July but she's not hit the same level since and was a fading seventh at Hamilton on stable debut in September; record now 1-11 and has something to prove after six months off.

quotes.race: Tips For Every Race At raceday-ready.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Six [furlongs] is definitely Carmarthen's trip. She leaves a lot for herself, I'm not saying she's ungenuine but she's still learning and it took a horse to come to her before she could put the race to bed.
