She idled pretty much the whole way and, if we direct her the right way, she should be winning again  - Edward Greatrex, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Raft Up
runners.comment: Made it 2-2 in a hood when completing a Newcastle double 18 days ago; big player again
runners.spotlight: Back to form with a hood added when scoring at Newcastle (6f, Tapeta) last month and he defied a penalty with a brave success there seven days later; up another 3lb but he remains feasibly treated and is a big player again.

runners.name: Heartrate
runners.owner: Horn And Trumpet Lads & S & A Mares
runners.comment: Snapped a long losing run over C&D last month; up 3lb but has claims if he gets some luck
runners.spotlight: Snapped a long losing streak when scoring off a reduced mark over C&D last month; back up 3lb but his confidence should be boosted after that success and has claims if he gets a good pace and some luck.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Stallion Book Handicap
quotes.quote: Heartrate drifted from 5-4 to 13-2 and we couldn't get our head around it as we thought he'd go well. I liked the look of him at the sales, he's a big, strong horse and has plenty of form, including on the all-weather. He was bought as a fun horse and we'll keep him going through the year. He looked good in what probably wasn't the strongest race for the grade - Mark Loughnane, trainer.

runners.name: Red Walls
runners.comment: Ten-time AW winner who ran well over C&D latest and he could make a bold bid
runners.spotlight: Not easy to predict but he's a ten-time AW winner who scored at Chelmsford in January and was beaten less than 2l over C&D last Monday; usually races prominently and he's not ruled out.

2:30.race_name: Happy Birthday Sheila James Mares' Handicap Hurdle (J Morgan & R Stevens Mem)(Challenger Mares' Hdl)

runners.name: Larchmont Lass
runners.comment: Below form at Kempton Christmas meeting but landed a good prize here (2m5f) in November
runners.spotlight: 2-8 over hurdles; ran in snatches and was below form at Kempton over Christmas but landed a good prize here (2m5f, good) in November and should be fine over today's longer trip; obvious contender if back on song.

quotes.race: BetMGM Richard Barber Memorial Mares' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I did wonder if the ground was a bit quick for Larchmont Lass but she stayed on nicely and is a good strong mare. She's a better mare on soft ground and she's got loads of stamina. It's a fantastic race to win - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: EBF Mares' 'National Hunt' Novices' Hurdle (EBF Mares' NH Novices' Hurdle Series Qua') (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We ran Larchmont Lass over two (miles) the last twice and it was too sharp for her. This was going to be much more her trip as long as she settled. If that was heavy ground, I'd definitely run her in a Grade 2 at Sandown this month and ride her like we did there and then she'd qualify for the mares' final at Newbury in March - Paul Nicholls, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Mares' Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We thought Larchmont Lass would improve for some slower ground. She was a bit keen at Wincanton hence why we put the hood on today to settle her. She is a lovely mare and she won't run again now. She won't go to Aintree as Seeyouinmydreams is going there. She is already jumping hurdles at home and she will go novice hurdling next season. She jumps great and another summer will do her the world of good. She will be a proper one to go novice hurdling next season - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She finally got off the mark over hurdles when we upped her in trip at Wincanton. She wasn't disgraced after that in handicap company; we probably gave her too much to do when she was fourth in the mares' final at Newbury. She loves cut in the ground, so it doesn't look like being soft enough at Wincanton on Saturday, where the Richard Barber race would have suited her, and we'll wait a little longer. I'd be hopeful there's more to come as her mark looks very fair. 04-11-24

runners.name: Bethpage
runners.comment: Did well over shorter trip last year but absent since disappointing run here in November
runners.spotlight: Launched handicap career with three good-ground wins last spring (2m1f-2m5f) and was placed on her next two outings (2m4f/2m5f, good); could still have more to offer over 3m but we haven't seen her since a disappointing run here in November; had wind op in January.

runners.name: Briefly
runners.comment: Close/clear second to a next-time-out winner over C&D on last month's handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Won 2m3f Bangor maiden on good ground last summer and, following a six-month absence, looked very well suited by the step up in trip when close/clear second to a next-time-out winner over C&D (soft; first-time tongue-tie) on handicap debut in February; went up 6lb for that but she still has strong claims today.

4:00.race_name: Wincanton Supports The RSA Mares' Handicap Chase (Challenger Mares' Chase Series Qual') (GBB Race)

runners.name: Space Voyage
runners.comment: Made it 2-4 over fences with a 15l success at Market Rasen eight days ago; major player
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner over hurdles who made it 2-4 over fences with a 15l success in first-time blinkers at Market Rasen (3m, good) eight days ago; Beau Morgan's claim partly offsets the 7lb penalty and she is a major player once again.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Mares' Handicap Chase (Challenger Mares' Chase Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Space Voyage has had terrible wind issues so that was a real bonus. Wherever the final of this series is, she'll be there - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Every Race Live On Racing TV Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Space Voyage is a mare that does too much in her races so we're running her over shorter than ideal. She enjoyed it around here and will jump a fence in time - Lewis Stones, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: She ran twice in bumpers during the spring, winning the second time at Market Rasen. I haven't run her since but her schooling over hurdles has gone very well. She'll want a trip in time but the plan is to start her off over 2m in a maiden hurdle. 22-12-22

runners.name: Legends Ryde
runners.comment: Off for 761 days before finishing a well-beaten fourth of five at Taunton last month
runners.spotlight: Three wins over fences in 2021/22, but had been off for 761 days before finishing a well-beaten fourth of five at Taunton (2m7f, soft) last month (below-par Space Voyage finished behind); others make greater appeal.

stable_tour.quote: We had our best season last term and she played a big part with three wins in novice handicap chases. She officially improved 10lb during the season and collected about Â£50,000, including some Great British Bonuses. We may start off in an intermediate chase at Newton Abbot later this month or there's a mares' race at Hereford as an alternative. She looks very well and I hope we can pick up some mares' Listed chases. She won over 3m2f, which suited her well, and on soft ground she will surely add to her five career successes. 05-10-22

runners.name: Moviddy
runners.comment: 0-10 over regulation fences but chased home a subsequent winner at Fakenham last month
runners.spotlight: 0-10 over regulation fences but she has often run well, as when chasing home a subsequent winner in a four-runner contest at Fakenham (2m5f, good) last month; still has to prove her stamina for this far under rules, but still a player in another small field.

runners.name: Getbazoutofhere
runners.comment: Dual winner on good ground last year; pulled up last time but has bounced back before
runners.spotlight: Mainly consistent, including winning twice on good ground at Hereford (3m1f) last year; pulled up at Fakenham (2m5f, good) in January but she bounced back from a similar performance early last year; respected.

4:30.race_name: Cheese & Cider Night 16th April Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Jaramillo
runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner; ran well from the front when placed on chase debut at Southwell
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner who ran well from the front when third on chasing debut at Southwell (2m4f, good to soft) in December; tended to jump left there so this switch to a right-handed track is a slight worry but, on the flipside, the forecast faster ground is a big plus.

stable_tour.quote: A very quirky individual who has done well for us. He hasn't run for ages because he doesn't like soft ground but hopefully he'll be out in the spring. He took well to a bit of schooling over fences and he ran really well at Southwell in December. He'll do very well when the ground dries up. He's got a lot of class. 05-03-25

runners.name: Pepe Le Moko
runners.comment: Penultimate run hinted at possible return to form but he was lacklustre last time
runners.spotlight: Dual 2m4f chase winner last season (soft/good to soft); back on a very good mark now and hinted at a possible return to form when respectable fourth at Ludlow last month but he was lacklustre at Warwick since and now has it all to prove again.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice horse and is going the right way over fences. He didn't grow that much in the summer at four and did all his growing at five - he looks a different horse to 12 months ago. He was impressive when winning at Warwick on his chasing debut and he jumped like an old handicapper. He bumped into a very well-handicapped horse in the Venetia Williams-trained Oxygen at Plumpton and the track might not have been ideal for him. He'll probably go up in grade now and there's a few options for him, including a handicap chase at Kempton on Saturday and a novice handicap chase at Cheltenham on Trials day on January 27. 11-01-24

runners.name: Somespring Special
runners.comment: Out of form when last seen last summer but may have been refreshed by latest stable switch
runners.spotlight: Suffered dip in form after her two good-ground wins for Anthony Honeyball last spring (2m3f/2m) and there was no upturn on last summer's debut for Chris Gordon; makes debut for latest new stable after an eight-month break and with quite a bit to prove but she's on a workable mark; well worth keeping an eye on in the betting.

quotes.race: NAF Mares' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: That was very good. Somespring Special is better on that ground and I was really pleased with how she travelled and went like a two-miler - at Plumpton she found it all very fast. She was economical over her fences too. It was a bit of a chuckaway entry at first but when she won at Plumpton we thought she had to run. I was shocked by her price, I usually have a good idea what they'll go off, but I thought she'd be much bigger - Anthony Honeyball, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's going chasing this season and we're hoping she can progress up to competing in Listed mares' novice chases. She'll need to improve but there's some 0-120s and hopefully she'd be ready in time for those. 12-10-23

runners.name: Onethreefivenotout
runners.comment: Well beaten in all three handicaps (two chases) since last season's maiden hurdle win here
runners.spotlight: Won maiden hurdle here in February 2024 (1m7f, heavy; first-time cheekpieces) but well beaten in all three subsequent handicaps, the last twice over fences this season (2m/3m); drops back to intermediate trip today and is not written off just yet but it takes a leap of faith to support him.

stable_tour.quote: Considering he's so fragile it was amazing he stood so much racing last season. As he'd been off the best part of two years he was understandably green, but we eventually found a winning opening at Wincanton. Following a wind op he'll have one run in a handicap hurdle, then we might try chasing. 04-11-24

3:00.race_name: Golf Membership On Sale Now Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Shengai Enki
runners.comment: Placed off today's mark since last month's Fontwell win; likely contender again
runners.spotlight: Back in good form this year, winning in refitted cheekpieces at Fontwell (2m5f, soft) before good third off today's mark at Market Rasen (2m4f, good to soft); also suited by good ground and seems very likely to make his presence felt again.

runners.name: George Henry
runners.comment: Unexposed 6yo who has shown promise in three novice hurdles this season; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 6yo who was placed in a soft-ground bumper last spring and has also shown promise in three novice hurdles this season (2m-2m4f); untested on ground quicker than good to soft but should have some improvement to come in handicaps.

runners.name: Mr Mackay
runners.comment: Consistent over fences/hurdles on goodish ground this season and has slipped to good mark
runners.spotlight: Pretty consistent over fences and hurdles on good/good to soft ground this season and has slipped to a good mark; campaigned mainly at around 2m but has won over an extended 2m3f; probably won't be far away.

quotes.race: Racing TV Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mr Mackay had fitness on his side and his jumping has always been good, and I wanted to put it to good use. He tries hard and has a good attitude and, as the trainer would insist on me saying, he is for sale! He's actually quite a quick horse and you could easily drop him to a stiff two miles and be good and positive on him. He didn't take much of a blow afterwards, and while the weather is still nice hopefully he can collect again - Sam Twiston-Davies, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Rascal
runners.comment: Ran okay last month, after a layoff, and remains quite lightly raced; major player
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 7yo who returned from a layoff with a fairly encouraging 2m run last month; needs that outing to have brought him on but he's on a workable mark, will be suited by the forecast good ground and is unexposed over this sort of trip.

5:00.race_name: Wincanton Fireworks On Sale Now Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Albert Park

prev_owners.owner: L J Williams & J D Packer Syndicate

runners.comment: Placed twice off higher marks last spring and might have needed recent return run
runners.spotlight: Made low-key return from 260-day absence at Taunton (2m3f, good; behind Mach Ten) a fortnight ago and is now 0-8 over hurdles but was placed off higher marks in two 2m handicaps (both on good) last spring and has good claims here if judged on those exploits.

runners.name: Mach Ten
runners.comment: Bettered poor handicap debut when third at Taunton this month; visor may aid more progress
runners.spotlight: Pulled up over 2m5f here on last month's handicap debut but fared much better when keeping-on third at Taunton (2m3f, good); a fortnight ago; made his jockey work very hard on that recent outing but is a big player if the first-time visor helps to keep him motivated.

runners.name: Flash In The Pan
runners.comment: Just a modest fourth in a junior hurdle this month; improvement needed on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Kept on for modest fourth against own age group at Taunton (2m, good) a fortnight ago and is still unexposed after only four hurdling starts but probably needs improvement on this handicap debut and is not bred to benefit from the step up in trip.

runners.name: Basman Palace
runners.comment: 0-9 over hurdles and needs to find something extra over this new trip
runners.spotlight: Didn't run badly when midfield on his last two outings (2m/1m7f) and continues to slip down the weights but is 0-9 over hurdles now and needs to find something extra over today's longer trip.

runners.name: Jventile
runners.breeder: E U R L Agb Agency & S Berger
runners.comment: Pulled up in first two handicaps (hurdle/chase); returns from seven-month absence today
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on last summer's handicap hurdle debut (jumped poorly) and also when tried over fences a few weeks later (bled from the nose); returns from seven-month break with a huge amount to prove; hood added.

stable_tour.quote: We'll run her back over fences again in the spring. We've hopefully got to the bottom of her issues and she can prove herself after the break. 18-12-24

runners.name: Gorcombe Moonshine
runners.comment: Back from break with two good efforts this winter but flopped this month; now 1-27 overall
runners.spotlight: Won over fences in 2023 but is 0-17 over hurdles; returned from six-month break with two good efforts on soft ground this winter (2m2f chase/2m hurdle) but his hurdle run here (1m7f, good to soft) 18 days ago was disappointing and he has become rather frustrating.

runners.name: Breccia
runners.comment: Ran quite well over 2m1f on last year's handicap hurdle debut; 2m Flat winner in December
runners.spotlight: Not seen over hurdles since respectable fourth on handicap debut at Newton Abbot (2m1f, good) last August but she won a 2m AW race on Boxing Day and, with her Flat stamina in mind, she's of interest over a new trip.

runners.name: Bradman
runners.comment: Dual Flat winner; well beaten at big odds on all three hurdling starts; up in trip today
runners.spotlight: Dual 1m4f AW winner at a lowly level for Charlie Fellowes in January 2024 but was a well-beaten outsider in three hurdle races for Kevin Bishop this winter (1m7f-2m); needs combination of new trip and good ground to show him in a better light on this handicap debut.

runners.name: Prairie Queen
runners.comment: Ran well for a long way two starts ago but was quickly back in the doldrums last time
runners.spotlight: Ran well for a long way when fifth in first-time tongue-tie at Bangor (2m3f, soft) last month, in second handicap, but was quickly back in the doldrums on her latest outing and can't be supported with much confidence.

runners.name: Crest Of Honour
runners.comment: Did not show much in four junior hurdles in the autumn but may improve in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Did not show a great deal in four junior hurdles at around 2m in the autumn but tries a new trip and sports first-time cheekpieces on this handicap debut; improvement possible.

3:30.race_name: Andy Mcdonald's 70th Birthday "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Bara Tara
runners.comment: Unable to justify prominence in betting when well beaten in course bumper in January
runners.spotlight: Flat-bred 5yo who was unable to justify his prominence in the betting when well beaten in course bumper on debut in January; needs to take a huge step forward on this hurdling debut.

runners.name: Disguisedlimit
runners.comment: Irish point winner who was placed on first three hurdling starts; leading contender here
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner who has been placed on all three hurdling starts this season, most recently when third of 14 at Taunton (2m, good) a fortnight ago; tends to race a bit too freely and his form isn't anything to go wild about but he's a leading contender here.

stable_tour.quote: A very nice horse we bought at Cheltenham in the spring from Ireland, where he won a point-to-point at Curraghmore on his debut. He'll be out in about two to three weeks' time and would be my Trainer's Pick. 30-10-24

runners.name: Now I Know
runners.comment: Well beaten at triple-digit odds in two Kempton novice/maiden hurdles this season
runners.spotlight: Well beaten at triple-digit odds in two Kempton novice/maiden hurdles this season (both 2m, good to soft); this race is easier but he remains difficult to enthuse over.

runners.name: Saddlers Dream
runners.comment: Showed no significant promise in his two bumpers or when 300-1 for a recent maiden hurdle
runners.spotlight: Showed no significant promise in his two bumpers or when 300-1 for recent maiden hurdle at Taunton (2m, good).

runners.name: Barford Groover
runners.comment: Nearly caused 150-1 shock in a bumper in 2023 but well beaten on only subsequent start
runners.spotlight: Nearly caused 150-1 shock in good-ground Bangor bumper for Mitchell Hunt in April 2023 but was not seen again until 37l defeat in soft-ground Huntingdon bumper for Tim Vaughan in January; back on a sound surface for this stable/hurdle debut but not an easy mare to weigh up.

runners.name: Lusso Milan
runners.comment: Began hurdling career with three disappointing runs for O'Neill stable; now in new yard
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in two bumpers for Jonjo O'Neill last season but began hurdling career with three disappointing runs in November/December (1m7f-2m5f) and has since changed hands; significant improvement required.

runners.name: Zaochen Enki
runners.comment: Second over hurdles in France last summer and makes British debut in very ordinary race
runners.spotlight: Out of a useful French Flat-racer who has produced a handful of winning jumpers; shaped with significant promise when second of ten on debut in France last summer (2m3f, good to soft) and makes British debut in a very ordinary race; hood added.

stable_tour.quote: A late summer arrival, he'd shown promise on his only run over hurdles in the French provinces. He should be out after Christmas. 04-11-24
